t: Psalm 49
The Folly of Trusting in Riches.
For the choir director. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.
Hear*pn this, all peoples; Give*ln ear, all inhabitants of the world,
Both*ln low and high, Rich*ln and poor together.
My*ln mouth will speak wisdom, And*ln the meditation of my heart will*i be*i understanding.
I*ln will incline my ear to a proverb; I*ln will express my riddle on the harp.
Why*ln should I fear in days of adversity, When*ln the iniquity of my foes surrounds me,
Even*ln those who trust in their wealth And*ln boast in the abundance of their riches?
No*ln man can by any means redeem his*i brother Or*ln give to God a ransom for him—
For*ln the redemption of his soul is costly, And*ln he should cease trying*i forever—
That*ln he should live on eternally, That*ln he should not undergo decay.
For*ln he sees that*i even*i wise men die; The*ln stupid and the senseless alike perish And*ln leave their wealth to others.
Their*ln inner thought is that*i their houses are forever And*iln their dwelling places to all generations; They*ln have called their lands after their own names.
But*ln man in his*i pomp will not endure; He*ln is like the beasts that perish.
This*ln is the way of those who are foolish, And*ln of those after them who approve their words. Selah.

As*ln sheep they are appointed for Sheol; Death*ln shall be their shepherd; And*ln the upright shall rule over them in the morning, And*ln their form shall be for Sheol to consume So*ln that they have no habitation.
But*ln God will redeem my soul from the power of Sheol, For*ln He will receive me. Selah.
Do*ln not be afraid when a man becomes rich, When*ln the glory of his house is increased;
For*ln when he dies he will carry nothing away; His*ln glory will not descend after him.
Though*ln while he lives he congratulates himself— And*ln though men*i praise you when you do well for yourself—
He*ln shall go to the generation of his fathers; They*ln will never see the light.
Man*ln in his*i pomp, yet without understanding, Is*ln like the beasts that perish.
